channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: California’s salmon fishermen are making their living from whale watchers and sea burials because the fishery is closed for a 2nd year
item.description: Salmon must swim upstream to lay their eggs, and young fish make their way out to the ocean through California's waterways — something done more easil...

item.title: Dolce & Gabbana looks beyond fashion to safeguard independence
item.description: Dolce & Gabbana bets on beauty for independence, eyeing €1 billion in sales by 2027 as it expands beyond fashion into real estate and hospitality.

item.title: Trump and Putin to Discuss Ukraine in Phone Call: What to Know

item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Tuesday’s attack on Gaza came after Hamas said no to the latest proposals by mediators, which included releasin...

item.title: Hong Kong Adds to China’s Growing Criticism of Panama Canal Deal
item.description: The city’s chief executive said a deal between the Hong Kong conglomerate CK Hutchison and BlackRock, a major American investment firm, requires “seri...

item.title: After public backlash over a confusing abortion ruling, Arizona’s Supreme Court is using human-like AI avatars named Victoria and Daniel to explain its decisions
item.description: The new chief justice says an avatar video could have helped the public better understand the legal underpinnings of the lengthy decision.

item.title: Russia Escalated Sabotage to Pressure U.S. and Allies on Ukraine, Study Says
item.description: Anger at Russia’s covert efforts, which included targeting undersea cables, warehouses and railways, has the potential to influence European reactions...

item.title: Rivian CEO RJ Scaringe on steering through the mess
item.description: Also: Trump will call Putin today, Microsoft almost passed on Nadella.

item.title: Deadly New Strikes in Gaza, and Abortion Arrests in Texas
In Europe and Japan, Luxury Sleeper Trains
item.description: From the Lake District in England to a lush island in Japan, here’s a way to travel — and sleep — in style.

item.title: Americans Describe Being Detained as Hostages in a Venezuelan Prison
item.description: They were American tourists hoping for a good time, they said. Then they became captives of an autocratic government.

item.title: Israel Resumes Attacks in Gaza After Stalled Cease-Fire Talks with Hamas
item.description: While Israel has stopped short of a ground invasion for now, its new strikes in Gaza seem to be an effort to force concessions from Hamas.

item.title: Russia and China hitting Western democracies with ‘massive digital arsenals’ says EU
item.description: "We must not underestimate the power that this has over us, or the intentions of those behind it."
